Event.name: Coming_to_believe
Event.definition:
<def-root>A person (the <fen>Cognizer</fen>) comes to believe something (the <fen>Content</fen>), sometimes after a process of reasoning. This change in belief is usually initiated by a person or piece of <fen>Evidence</fen>. Occasionally words in this domain are accompanied by phrases expressing <fen>Topic</fen>, i.e. that which the mental <fen>Content</fen> is about.
<ex><fex name="Evidence">Based on the most recent census</fex> <fex name="Cognizer">I</fex> have <t>concluded</t> <fex name="Content">that most Americans sleep too much</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Cognizer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Sue</fex> <t>realized</t> that Bob was lost.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Evidence
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by <ment>from</ment> which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
<ex>I have <t>learned</t> <fex name="Evidence">from experience</fex> that poison oak can be painful.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Content
Arg.definition: <def-root>With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP: <ex>The President <t>learned</t> <fex name="Content">that the reporters were hungry</fex>.</ex> <ex>The children <t>determined</t> <fex name="Content">the answer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They <t>found out</t> <fex name="Topic">about us</fex>! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:
<ex>The jury <t>learned</t> something terrible <fex name="Topic">about the suspect</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="">Degree</fex> to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes to believe the <fen>Content</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Depictive phrase describing the Cognizer.
<ex>We <t>realized</t> it <fex name="Dep">eating dinner</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which enables them to figure something out. <ex><fex name="Means">A post-mortem examination</fex> was unable to <t>ascertain</t> the cause of death.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> discovers the <fen>Content</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the text created by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to communicate that they came to believe a specified <fen>Content</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pla">Back at the tailor's shop</fex>, I <t>deduced</t> that our murderer was not the owner of the kerchief.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: ascertain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: get to know.

lexUnit.name: conclude.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arrive at a judgement or opinion by reasoning.

lexUnit.name: conclusion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a judgement or decision reached by reasoning

lexUnit.name: deduce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arrive at (a fact or a conclusion) by reasoning.

lexUnit.name: deduction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a conclusion that has been deduced

lexUnit.name: guess.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an estimate or conjecture

lexUnit.name: guess.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: estimate or suppose (something) without sufficient information to be sure of being correct

lexUnit.name: infer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deduce from evidence and reasoning rather than from explicit statements.

lexUnit.name: inference.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a conclusion reached on the basis of evidence and reasoning.

lexUnit.name: learn.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: acquire knowledge of or skill in (something) through study or experience or by being taught

lexUnit.name: realization.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: realization is a derivative of realize

lexUnit.name: realize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become fully aware of as a fact; understand clearly.

lexUnit.name: surmise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: suppose without having evidence.

lexUnit.name: figure out.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: reach an understanding of someone or something

lexUnit.name: find.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to ascertain information or a fact, usually by reasoning because of a piece of evidence

lexUnit.name: puzzle out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: figure out

lexUnit.name: work out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: figure out

lexUnit.name: determine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ascertain or establish by research or calculation.

lexUnit.name: speculate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form a theory or conjecture without firm evidence.

lexUnit.name: strike.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: coming to a sudden realization.

lexUnit.name: gather.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to infer from context
